name: Toby: The Secret Mine
description: A challenging puzzle platformer inspired by games like Limbo and Badland.
minimum_requirements: OS: Win 7 or later Processor: Intel Core i3 or better Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Intel HD 4000 or better DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 800 MB available space

reviews.review_text: if you liked Limbo and considering to try this game, do not. Play Limbo again

I was supplied with this key by the developer, this however did not affect the review. All my developer sponsored reviews are positive because I pick the good ones ═══════════════════════════════════  OVERVIEW

Want to give this game 3.5 stars before playing the last level (level 21). This game is definitely not as good as Limbo (which should be 5 stars for sure) though I'll still put a RECOMMENDED.  However, after playing the last level, I would give this game at most 3 stars. I don't see any rationality that you don't put any checkpoint in the last level. It's kind of boring when I know all the tricks but still need to try a lot of times to pass the level. If you go to Limbo, there's nowhere that you know the tricks but still need a lot of luck to go through.  I spent 4 hours on the game but more than one hour on the last level. I really felt annoyed after the 10th try.

Having seen other reviews before purchase, I hoped this game would be a lot like Limbo, as I enjoyed that game a lot.  And it is a lot like Limbo indeed, but the lacking story, annoying visuals (like hidden caves that remain hidden until you stumble into them) and puzzles that have more to do with timing jumps than thinking left me feeling disappointed.

Pre-completion review. (Key given by developer) --------------------------------------------------- If you loved Limbo, you will definitely love this game. It has the similar feel, but this game is a little bit lighter in terms of its graphics. The puzzles are also good so far, I haven't finished it yet, but this is one of the hidden gems I'd definitely recommend to a friend who loves puzzle and platforming games.

Toby: The Secret Mine has everything what you expected from looking on the screenshots and videos. Beautiful art together with the music makes amazing gameplay experience against logic puzzles.  The non-verbal story is also attractive as you can decide on your own what really happens in the Toby's world. It's worth to play it, as this adventure is somehow unique and personal, even if it's inspired by Limbo so much.  Good work!
A Very well made puzzle-platformer game.
Nice game, if short. Pick it up on sale. Last fight is straight up BS. If it saved halfway through, it wouldn't be, but it doesn't. Still going to recommend it, though.
I got it on sale. A bit too short but I enjoyed it. You die a lot. After 100th death you get an achievement ;)
My game crashes on 2 level help

This game truly blows my mind with it’s beautiful and well done atmospheres, the color design for each level, particle effects and overall feel is great compared to the game Limbo, in which Toby is generally compared too. I have played Limbo and Toby is far from it but in this case the silhouette and awesome atmospheres works very well together, I spent over an hour playing Toby the other day and felt like I could keep on going forever!

Production quality is good, but I just am not enjoying it. Puzzles are clever and fun, but fairly infrequent. Jumping is the single mechanic you have and it doesn't feel good. Lastly, most punishing platformers like this make death interesting/entertainment in some way to make up for the frequency. However, it's not interesting in this game. A lot of times it's obfuscated by the world element that killed you.   I think there's potential here for something good, but as it stands I'm not having fun.

This game is not so good. It tries to be lke Limbo, but it does not have a gameplay solid enough to even get close to it. It also has some bugs that I had to restart the level in order to be able to continue playing the game.
From what I've played so far it's a puzzle platform game and I've playing it and I would recommend it to anyone that likes puzzle platform games :)

This puzzle platformer has a very nice ambience with its well thought design and distinct art concept. You'll find tough challenges but overall you'll pass enemies bravely.  Expect to find some bugs like getting stuck while activating levers on the edge of platforms, forcing you to repeat some levels from the beggining since checkpoints not always work. Some feats could be improved like flagging missing friends over tree level.

Very fun and challenging Platforming game.   The tone, Artwork and music all work amazingly together.   Enjoyed every minute and would gladly play a sequel. Had to see the multiple endings as well.   Good times.
